External format

Determines the following attributes of a character (text) file:

  • character encoding, which depends on the natural language represented,
  • the newline translation, for example CRLF, LF or CR ('carriage return' and/or 'linefeed' codes).

External format designators are specific to an implementation or application but comply with the generally accepted character set list.

See also
  • W3C i18n: character set lists
